article.headline: UC Irvine 74, Pacific 59
article.story: IRVINE, Calif. (AP) -- Patrick Sanders scored 25 points and Darren Fells added 23 points with 11 rebounds to lead UC Irvine to a 74-59 victory on Thursday over conference leading Pacific. The victory gave coach Pat Douglass his 164th victory as the Anteaters coach, passing Bill Mulligan for the most in school history. Irvine opened the game making four of its first five shots, led by Sanders, who scored 13 points in the half. Irvine (11-13, 6-5) had a six-point lead at halftime, but missed its first six shots to open the second half. The Tigers (17-7, 8-3) got as close as two points when Casey Neimeyer hit a jumper with 16:10 left. The Anteaters got to the free throw line enough to go on a 7-0 run to pull away. Steffan Johnson scored 17 points and Chad Troyer added 14 to lead Pacific. With the victory, Irvine avenged a 59-53 loss to Pacific on Jan. 19 in Stockton.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
